title: What are the latest COVID 19 fraud and scam floating on the net? - Quora

response.answer_text: The fraud rate is increasing amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Scammers are using trend fraudulent attempts to get access to online user accounts. Account takeover fraud, payment scams, and identity theft are becoming most common in the COVID-19. As per the latest COVID-19 fraud and scams, fraudsters are offering the coronavirus tests to the beneficiaries opt for medical care. Tests are given in exchange for personal details which include the medical data and records of the patients. These services provided are illegitimate and insecure.Scammers are targeting the medical care beneficiaries in various ways which include text messages, calls, visits, and social media platforms. Users are been targeted and their personal information is stolen which is further used in financial crimes and another list of malevolent activities.Fraudsters are taking advantage of coronavirus crises where all businesses have got digital and there are more opportunities for them to perform cyber attacks and get useful information. Identity theft and medical data theft is also on a rise where data is stolen to get medical benefits for free, insurance details are stolen to get funds and benefits illegally.The need for an hour, therefore, is to be vigilant when it comes to doing digital activities. Whether it is online shopping, making transactions online or online gaming, etc. all are becoming golden opportunities for fraudsters. I hope this helps!

In the U.K. there are reports of texts or phone calls saying someone close to you has tested positive for covid and you need to get tested , then they try to charge you £50 for the test to be sent to you. Tests is U.K. are free
